2018-11-11T17:16:18Z: Hulkenberg and Sainz go wheel to wheel - pretty vigorously - for 13th.
2018-11-11T17:15:46Z: 1 Hamilton, 2 Bottas, 3 Vettel, 4 Raikkonen, 5 Verstappen, 6 Leclerc.
2018-11-11T17:15:39Z: Ocon has gone further backwards after his grid penalty, he's down in 19th with only Vandoorne behind him.
2018-11-11T17:15:14Z: Ricciardo is already into the top 10, passing Ericsson for ninth now. Next target is Gasly in eighth.
2018-11-11T17:14:59Z: Bottas had a look at Hamilton into Turn 4, forcing the leader to defend. Hopefully it's game on today between the team-mates.
2018-11-11T17:14:41Z: Verstappen and Raikkonen fight over fourth, and eventually it's the Finn who makes it stick to reclaim the place.
2018-11-11T17:14:19Z: Ericcson has immediately lost ground from that career-best sixth on the grid, with Leclerc taking that spot ahead of Grosjean.
2018-11-11T17:14:01Z: Good start for Hamilton, Vettel locks up into Turn 1, and Bottas sweeps around the outside of the Ferrari to take second!
2018-11-11T17:13:01Z: Here we go - the cars are lining up on the grid.
2018-11-11T17:11:37Z: Most of the top 10 start on supersofts, but the Ferraris are on softs. Outside the top 10, it's all softs except Ricciardo and Perez on supersofts and Hartley on mediums.
2018-11-11T17:11:34Z: Slow getaway for Vettel, who had to have a few goes at getting off the line. It looked like he was struggling to get first gear, and a few cars went past him before he set off. He's now back in the right place behind Hamilton in the queue.
2018-11-11T17:10:18Z: Hamilton sets off to lead the field away for the formation lap.
2018-11-11T17:09:36Z: Tyre warmers off, engines fired up, it's almost time.
2018-11-11T17:08:43Z: We're not going to get anyone's hopes up about it raining. The forecast seems to change every five minutes, and the latest talk is that there could be rain towards the end of the race. So, as always seems to the case, our money is on it raining about 10 minutes after the finish, just as all the people working in the paddock have to be out and about working hard - and getting wet.
2018-11-11T17:04:11Z: We've got a sunny, dry start, which means we can talk tyres (yay). Ferrari has its cars on what should be the better race tyre - the soft - while Mercedes and Red Bull are on the supersoft. Normally you'd think that means advantage Ferrari, but it was the Italian team that made the softest compound work from the start in the USA, where Raikkonen snatched the lead from Hamilton to set up his first victory in years. Mercedes will need something similar today.
2018-11-11T17:00:48Z: Welcome to live coverage of the 2018 Brazilian Grand Prix.
